task_summary: Perceive and grasp the drawer handle, then execute an opening motion and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: The robot aligns to a cabinet drawer visible across the frames, localizes the horizontal bar handle, plans a side grasp, and latches on. After securing the grasp, it uses a container-opening primitive suited for drawers to pull the drawer outward, then retreats slightly to avoid collision with the panel. Timing and tolerances are conservative to ensure stable contact in a confined kitchen-like scene with a counter, tissue box, and cup.
preconditions: Drawer and handle visible within camera view
Arm workspace reachable to the handle
No obstruction between end-effector and handle
stepwise_plan: Open gripper and search/confirm handle presence
Move above and align yaw to handle orientation
Compute grasp and align precisely to contact
Close gripper and confirm stable grasp
Retreat to a safe standoff and pause
success_criteria: No collisions with cabinet or countertop
Robot ends in a safe standoff
failure_and_recovery: Handle not detected → raster scan and retry up to 3 times
Grasp slips → reopen, re-approach, and regrasp
Drawer jam → increase attempts or abort with safe retreat
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after drawer open action succeeds and retreat completes.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Prepare gripper with wide opening for bar handle.
Quick check if the handle is already visible.
Active search with raster pattern to find the handle.
Localize the handle and refine pose estimate.
Move to pregrasp height above the handle.
Rotate tool to align with horizontal bar handle.
Compute side-grasp pose on the handle bar.
Fine approach to meet tight alignment tolerance.
Latch onto the handle with moderate force.
Execute drawer-opening motion while grasping handle.
Back off to a safe standoff after opening.
Brief pause to stabilize the scene.

recovery_strategy: Fallback to raster scan and retry detection
Recompute grasp and re-approach with tighter tolerance
Reopen and regrasp with same force after reposition
Abort open and retreat if force thresholds trip
Repeat detect-align cycle up to limited attempts
assumptions: The visible handle is a horizontal bar suitable for a side grasp; frames show a cabinet with a shallow drawer near countertop height.
OpenContainer encapsulates the pull motion required to open the drawer; no separate pull primitive is exposed.

expected_success_criteria: Drawer visibly translated outward and robot safely standoff
No collision with cabinet or countertop
